category.title: Driven in Detroit: Bridges to Self-Reliance
category.subtitle: Videos: 12

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Organizing an Inner City Welfare Project
item.description: In Detroit, their first step to self-reliance was to identify programs and resources within the Church and community that could be used to help people strengthen their personal storehouse.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Addressing Inner City Welfare Needs
item.description: Church leaders in Detroit called several Church-service missionaries to mentor individuals who wanted to improve their situation and build community partnerships with other nonprofits.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Lamanais Louis on the Road to Self-Reliance
item.description: The Personal Storehouse Project helped Lamanais Louis go back to school to learn about computers. He now uses these skills to refurbish old computers for students in Detroit who cannot afford them.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Bridging the Eight-Mile Divide
item.description: The story of how ward boundaries broke the eight-mile divide—a very real boundary that divides Detroit.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Church Service Missionaries Role
item.description: The Church-service missionaries who mentor in inner-city Detroit build their mentorship on a foundation of friendship and love as they help others achieve their dreams and become more self-reliant.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Watsons, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: The Watsons moved to Detroit to follow an employment opportunity, but then ended up being laid off. Despite the unexpected turn of events, they don't let their challenges keep them from serving.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Delores Hubbard, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Delores’ life was filled with struggle, until the gospel gave her hope. Through the inner-city mission, Delores is working toward helping for recovering addicts and single mothers.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Blacks, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Valerie and Timothy Black are regular volunteers at the local soup kitchen, but several years ago, Brother Black was one of the people visiting the kitchen hoping for a meal.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Parkers, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: Although Raechel and Lamar didn't have good role models growing up, with the help of Elder and Sister Utley, they've been able to work towards a better future for themselves and their five children.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Humanitarian Outreach, Winter Clothing Distribution
item.description: The Detroit stake coordinated a Winter Clothing Distribution with community partners.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: Solomon Bills, On the Road to Self Reliance
item.description: After a career as a police officer in the inner-city, Solomon Bills realized that he'd become jaded. Wanting to get rid of these harsh feelings, he began to pray for a change of heart.

item.title: Driven in Detroit: The Rhodenizers on the Road to Self-Reliance
item.description: Josh and Shauna Rhodenizer came to Detroit for a medical residency and planned to leave shortly afterward, but they made Detroit their permanent home after realizing how much they loved the city.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Maddie Wilson
item.description: Maddie Wilson performs her original song “Freckles” on her guitar. Maddie wrote “Freckles” when she was talking to a friend of hers about how self-conscious she was. “Freckles” is a song about loving yourself how you are.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Leslie Fatai
item.description: Leslie Fatai Nau came to Mormon Channel Studio to share a message that has shaped her life: our joy in life can be limitless if we draw near to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Yahosh Bonner
item.description: In this episode, Yahosh Bonner performs an original song, “Angels Over Me” and one of his favorite hymns, “Savior, Redeemer of My Soul.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - The Kotter Experiment
item.description: The Kotter Experiment visited Mormon Channel Studio to perform an original song, “Let Go,” and an arrangement of the band’s favorite Primary song, “A Child’s Prayer.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Nadia Khristean
item.description: Nadia Khristean performs her original song “Broken” on her piano. The song was inspired by refugees.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Happy Medium
item.description: A group of friends that met in college call themselves Happy Medium. In this episode, Happy Medium performs an original song, “Home and Heart,” followed by their rendition of “I Need Thee Every Hour.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Bianca Merkley and Nicole Sheahan
item.description: Bianca Merkley sings her original song “At the Heart of it.” A song written during her struggle with infertility and miscarriage. She talks about how her relationship with God changed.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Kylie Hintze
item.description: If you’ve wondered whether you’re on the right path in life, you will relate to singer-songwriter Kylie Hintze’s and the original song she performs on this episode of Mormon Channel Studio.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Monica Scott
item.description: Monica Scott plays her original song “For Coey” on the piano accompanied by Sarah Arnesen on the cello. “For Coey” was written for the funeral of a friends son.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Enliven
item.description: The two members of the band Enliven were excused from high school classes in order to perform on this episode of Mormon Channel Studio.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Bri Ray
item.description: Bri Ray performs "Be Still My Soul" and "Holding."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Nik Day
item.description: Nik Day performs "Come, Come, Ye Saints" and "Miracle."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Ashley Hess and Amber Lynn
item.description: Ashley Hess and Amber Lynn perform "The Moment You Stand" and "Higher."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Madilyn Paige
item.description: Accomplished singer Madilyn Paige performs her original song “Irreplaceable” and her rendition of “Nearer, My God, to Thee.”

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Alex Melecio
item.description: Singer-songwriter Alex Melecio plays a brand-new original song, “What You Knew Then,” on his acoustic guitar. He also sings “Come Follow Me” in Spanish, accompanied on the piano by his wife, Melanie.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Eric Malizia
item.description: Eric Malizia sings "Nearer, My God, to Thee" and an original song for primary children, "100 Ways to Say Jesus."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Aspartame Sunshine
item.description: Listen to Mormon artists share their talents as they share with us an original song and cover of a Hymn.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Danny Heslop
item.description: Danny Heslop performs "Lead Kindly Light" and his original song "Spring."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Jason Lyle Black
item.description: Pianist Jason Lyle Black and violinist Becca Moench perform "Come, Thou Fount" and their original song, "Champs Elysse."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Scott Foster
item.description: Scott Foster performs "As Now We Take the Sacrament" and his original song, "Erase Me."

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Jake Lambson
item.description: Pianist Jake Lambson performs "If You Could Hie to Kolob" and an original song.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Firefly
item.description: Sisters Melanie, McKenzie, Madelyn make up the band Firefly, and in this episode they perform an original song, “Home of the Brave,” as well as an arrangement of “The Lord is My Light,” one of their favorites hymns.

item.title: Mormon Channel Studio - Madelyn Hosch
item.description: The songs performed by Madelyn Hosch in this episode of Mormon Channel Studio are all about light. First, she sings an original song called “Sun Sunshine,” followed by a beautiful rendition of “Help Me Teach with Inspiration.”

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Meet Sam and Luke – Episode 1
item.description: In the unique new documentary series Two Brothers Two, director Rick Stevenson takes us on a 10-year journey through the lives of the Nelson brothers, Sam, Luke, Tommy, and Joseph, as they struggle to find love for each other and for themselves.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Finally Friends – Episode 2
item.description: In the unique new documentary series Two Brothers Two, director Rick Stevenson takes us on a 10-year journey through the lives of the Nelson brothers, Sam, Luke, Tommy, and Joseph, as they struggle to find love for each other and for themselves.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: From Boys to Men – Episode 3
item.description: In the unique new documentary series Two Brothers Two, director Rick Stevenson takes us on a 10-year journey through the lives of the Nelson brothers, Sam, Luke, Tommy, and Joseph, as they struggle to find love for each other and for themselves.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Saving Lives and Reaching Dreams – Episode 4
item.description: In this episode, we find out what happened to 20-year-old Sam when the giant earthquake hit Chile, where he is serving a mission for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Preparing to Serve in Cambodia - Episode 5
item.description: In this episode, we experience ups and downs with 19-year-old Luke in the Missionary Training Center, where he is preparing to serve a mission for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Cambodia.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Teaching the Gospel in Cambodia - Episode 6
item.description: In this episode, we venture into Cambodia with 19-year-old Luke, who has been called to serve a mission there for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Learning to Love Others First - Episode 7
item.description: In this episode, 20-year-old Luke continues to learn and grow in Cambodia, where he is serving a mission for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Mission Accomplished - Episode 8
item.description: In this episode, 20-year-old Luke is finally hitting his stride in Cambodia, where he is serving as a missionary for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Facing the Future - Episode 9
item.description: Sam, who recently returned from his mission, is struggling to find how the new Sam fits in the old world.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Miracles and Making a Difference - Episode 10
item.description: Sam searches for a way to help his Chilean friend Luciano, who lost his leg and arm after a terrible accident.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Meet Tommy - Episode 11
item.description: We finally meet one of Sam's and Luke's younger brothers. Joseph Nelson is a talented pre-teen with a good sense of humor and a kind heart.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Finding True Happiness - Episode 12
item.description: Tommy learns that true happiness comes from serving others when he receives his mission call.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Meet Joseph, the Youngest Brother - Episode 13
item.description: When it comes to family relationships, though, Joseph is confident. Nothing comes between him and his brothers.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Choosing Faith - Episode 14
item.description: Joseph stays true to his faith while many of his high school friends are making lifestyle choices they will regret.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Catching Up with Luke - Episode 15
item.description: In this episode, we catch up with Luke when he returns from a 2-year mission for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Cambodia.

item.title: Two Brothers Two: Tommy's Mission - Episode 16
item.description: In this episode—the series finale—we watch Tommy prepare for and begin his mission in the Baltic region of Europe. Just when he is ready to give up, everything changes.

item.title: Step 1: Honesty - David’s Story about Sex Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 1 - Honesty: Admit that you, of yourself, are powerless to overcome your addictions and that your life has become unmanageable. Watch David's story about sex addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 2: Hope - Preston’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 2 - Hope: Come to believe that the power of God can restore you to complete spiritual health. Watch Preston's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 3: Trust in God - Sharon’s Story about Crystal Meth Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 3 - Trust in God: Decide to turn your will and your life over to the care of God the Eternal Father and His Son, Jesus Christ. Watch Sharon's story about crystal meth addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 4: Truth - Austin’s Story about Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 4 - Truth: Make a searching and fearless written moral inventory of yourself. Watch Austin's story about addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 5: Confession - Jessica’s Story about Food Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 5 - Confession: Admit to yourself, to your Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ, to proper priesthood authority, and to another person the exact nature of your wrongs.

item.title: Step 6: Change of Heart - Aram’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 6 - Change of Heart: Become entirely ready to have God remove all your character weaknesses. Watch Aram's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 7: Humility - Holly’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 7 - Humility: Humbly ask Heavenly Father to remove your shortcomings. Watch Holly's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 8: Forgiveness - Larry’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 8 - Seeking Forgiveness: Make a written list of all persons you have harmed and become willing to make restitution to them. Watch Larry's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 9: Restitution and Reconciliation - John’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 9 - Wherever possible, make direct restitution to all persons you have harmed. Watch John's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 10: Daily Accountability - Adrienne’s Story about Cocaine Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 10 - Daily Accountability: Continue to take personal inventory, and when you are wrong promptly admit it. Watch Adrienne's story about cocaine addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 11: Personal Revelation - Lindsay’s Story about Heroin Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 11 - Personal Revelation: Seek through prayer and meditation to know the Lord’s will and to have the power to carry it out. Lindsay's story about heroin addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 12: Service - Erik’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 12 - Service: Having had a spiritual awakening as a result of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, share this message with others and practice these principles in all you do. Watch Erik's story.

item.title: 12 Steps to Change - Series Trailer
item.description: Introducing 12 Steps to Change, an original Mormon Channel video series highlighting the real struggles and triumphs of people who have overcome addiction.

item.title: I Am Here - Bonner Family
item.description: The eight Bonner siblings and their parents, all talented vocalists in their own rights, gathered from around the country to compose and record this original song based on the hymn “I Need Thee Every Hour.”

item.title: Nearer, My God, to Thee
item.description: Images for this music video portray moments when Jesus Christ personally reached out to those who needed His help, love, and understanding. He still reaches out to us today.

item.title: Something Divine - Brooke White
item.description: Brooke White sings “Something Divine” to remind us that we are all children of God who has given us talents and responsibilities. “Don’t give up until your work is done.”

item.title: The First Noel - Lexi Walker
item.description: Singing phenomenon Lexi Walker makes a Christmas classic, "The First Noel," sound brand new in this music video about the true light of Christmas, the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: Music Video: I'm Trying to Be Like Jesus – Emily Brown
item.description: Emily Brown arranged and performed this version of the Primary song “I’m Trying to Be like Jesus” exclusively for Mormon Channel. Just as she is sharing goodness with all of you, share this video with your friends to spread the light and the love.

item.title: Love Is Spoken Here - Jenny Oaks Baker
item.description: Musician Jenny Oaks Baker and her family share their talents in this arrangement of “Love is Spoken Here.” Love at home is happiness at home.

item.title: Have I Done Any Good in the World Today?
item.description: Music video of "Have I Done Any Good in the World Today?" with Alex Boyé and Carmen Rasmusen Herbert.

item.title: See You On the Other Side - Shaun Canon
item.description: Shaun Canon sings "See You on the Other Side" about seeing our loved ones again after death. The gospel of Jesus Christ provides comfort by knowing that because of God's plan we can see our loved ones who have passed on to "the other side."

item.title: O Holy Night
item.description: The video depicts iconic scenes of our sweet Savior’s birth and the events that surrounded it, as well as touching moments in Jesus Christ’s life when His love and power changed the lives of those He served.

item.title: Love at Home
item.description: There is beauty all around when there's love at home.

item.title: Bullied - Let Us Be Kind
item.description: This simple story illustrates the power of love and forgiveness in the face of bullying.

item.title: The Old Shoemaker
item.description: In this classic story by Leo Tolstoy, an honest old shoemaker discovers that by helping those around him, he was really serving the Savior.

item.title: A Pure Love Story
item.description: Though the Lynns’ life is still quite different than most, Jenny and Mark have allowed this tragedy to strengthen their commitment and love for each other.

item.title: Brigham City Temple Art
item.description: Inside the newly completed Brigham City Temple are beautiful murals that depict the surrounding landscape and invite a wonderful spirit. Learn all about the process of creating these beautiful works from the artist, Gary Ernest Smith.

item.title: A Mormon Olympian
item.description: Olympic swimmer Andrew Rutherfurd is competing for Bolivia during the 2012 London games. Andrew is a world-class athlete and a devoted member of the Mormon faith. Learn about his journey to the Olympics and his faith in God.

item.title: A Chapel for Botswana
item.description: Latter-day Saints in Kasane, Botswana, sacrificed for years and traveled great distances to attend church services. Now they have a chapel to call their own.

item.title: Tests and Triumphs
item.description: Sterling and Christian Wyatt were both born with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, a crippling chronic disease. Despite their challenges, the young men each desired to serve a full-time mission.

item.title: Having the Holy Ghost
item.description: You can invite the Holy Spirit into your life through prayer, scripture study and being obedient to God’s commandments.

item.title: Increase Your Testimony
item.description: Strengthen your testimony of God and His teachings by recognizing the feelings of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Feeling the Holy Ghost
item.description: Feelings of the Holy Spirit can be likened to hope, joy and peace in your heart and mind.

item.title: Receiving Revelation
item.description: You can receive personal revelation from God by living His gospel and having the gift of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: The Coat
item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.title: His Grace: Drug Addiction and the Loss of a Loved One
item.description: By God’s grace we are able to overcome any challenge life brings. And with His Grace we are able to feel the much needed love and comfort amidst our trials.

item.title: His Grace: Unplanned Pregnancy, Adoption and The “Best Gift Ever”
item.description: When Katie became a single mother following an unplanned pregnancy, she couldn’t have imagined the impact her adoption story would have on her faith and others’.

item.title: Finding Your Purpose in Life: Does Faith Matter?
item.description: Rich Miller grew up believing completely in the reality and importance of the gospel. But Rich left his faith behind to search for another kind of truth. He was surprised by what he found.

item.title: Seminary Centennial
item.description: Look back at the 100-year history of the seminary program of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Learn about the men who began the program, and gain insights into how it changes lives. today.

item.title: Sculpting the Prophet
item.description: Blair Buswell has sculpted just about anything you can imagine, but his most cherished work is the bust of Church President Thomas S. Monson. Hear what it was like to work with the prophet, and find out what he told Buswell upon completion.

item.title: A Look Back: The Logan Tabernacle
item.description: Utah historian Kenneth Godfrey shares insight into the historic Logan Tabernacle and gives us a peek at its beautiful pioneer craftsmanship.

item.title: Inspired by The Coat
item.description: See how "The Coat," a Mormon Channel video of an experience from the life of Heber J. Grant, inspired a group of girls to give service.

item.title: I Pray When... #didyouthinktopray
item.description: People from all over the world submitted #didyouthinktopray photos to remind others to pray anytime about anything.

item.title: Family: One Big Experiment
item.description: The Oh family prefers to work on their chemistry while literally working on chemistry. They create a dry ice solution that will freeze household objects like candy, bottles, and even flowers.

item.title: Pizza with the Puentes
item.description: The Puentes have learned to channel the energy of their home into family chores and activities that are both fun and productive. One of their favorite activities is pizza making in their backyard.

item.title: Raising a Family: Learning the Ropes Together
item.description: Christy, Jay, and their four kids are experts at all sorts of interesting things, but they know their success outside of the home is actually the result of success within the home.

item.title: A Family Culture of Love
item.description: Meet the Pereira family. They love soccer, animals, and making bread because each of those things brings them closer together. Find out how in this episode of Happy Families.

item.title: What Family Means
item.description: The Davies bring new meaning to the phrase “one big, happy family.” With seven kids, Jim and Becky Davies’ family is bigger than they had dreamed it could be.

item.title: A Recipe For a Happy Family
item.description: Too many cooks in the kitchen? That is never a problem for the Chavez family. In fact, making a delicious meal elbow-to-elbow is their favorite way to spend time together.

item.title: Make It a Good Day
item.description: “I think being a mom is the most important job in the world—and I’m not joking,” says mother Clair Kenny, whose big family stars in the first episode of Mormon Channel’s brand new video series, “Happy Families.”

item.title: Blending Families: Love is Key
item.description: Love is the key—that is the motto the Goodjohn family lives by. Whether they are at home or at the park, you can bet that Nandi, Troy, and his daughter Dior are doing their best to show each other how much they care.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel Website
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Brother David M. McConkie, and Brother Matthew O. Richardson—come together to discuss the Teaching the Gospel website.

item.title: Teach People, Not Lessons
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—comes together to discuss teaching the gospel.

item.title: Prepare Spiritually
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—discusses how teachers can better prepare for lessons.

item.title: New Teachers
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency discusses how teachers can better prepare for lessons.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel Website
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—come together to discuss the Teaching the Gospel website. They also discuss how teachers can better prepare for lessons.

item.title: Teaching around the World
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: To Shake a Prophet's Hand
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency talks about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Help Is on the Way
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Help the Lost Sheep
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency comes together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Hunger for Knowledge
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel around the world.

item.title: How Do You Suppose I Know of These Things?
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel around the world.

item.title: Teaching around the World
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Brother David M. McConkie, and Brother Matthew O. Richardson—come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Diligent Learners
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe asks Elder Bednar how we can be diligent learners.

item.title: Acting and Not Being Acted Upon
item.description: Elder Bednar says that the best teachers invite their students to act upon what they're learning.

item.title: Fear Not Silence
item.description: Elder Bednar says that the Holy Ghost is the teacher. Teachers should give students time to ponder and let the Holy Ghost teach them.

item.title: Create Your Own Small Plates
item.description: Elder Bednar says, "If all we get is what the teacher presents, we're missing what matters most."

item.title: Create a Pattern of Acting
item.description: Elder Bednar says effective teaching is listening and observing so you can discern what the Holy Ghost wants you to teach.

item.title: The Holy Ghost is the Teacher
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe and Elder Bednar discuss how the Holy Ghost is the real teacher.

item.title: The Importance of Teaching in the Gospel, part 1
item.description: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Sunday School general president, interviews Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Inviting Learners to Act
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe asks Elder Bednar how teachers can get students involved.

item.title: Honor People's Agency
item.description: Elder Bednar says teachers must honor students' agency. The Holy Ghost carries a message unto their hearts. The learners have to act in faith in order to get the message into their hearts.

item.title: I Have Learned for Myself
item.description: Elder Bednar discusses how we, like Joseph Smith, can learn for ourselves that the Gospel is true.

item.title: Elder David A. Bednar's Desire to Learn
item.description: Elder Bednar talks about how he gained such a strong desire to learn about the Gospel.

item.title: Motivate
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe asks Elder Bednar how teachers can motivate their students.

item.title: Help Me Understand
item.description: Elder Bednar says, "Inviting learners to act... is the highest manifestation of teaching."

item.title: The Importance of Teaching in the Gospel, part 2
item.description: This is the second episode in which Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Sunday School general president, interviews Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Living with Depression
item.description: When Heather first recognized the symptoms of her depression, she felt ashamed. She also felt sure that with faith, prayer, and help from Jesus Christ, the depression could be taken away. She learned that prayers are answered in unexpected ways.

item.title: Facing Postpartum Anxiety and OCD
item.description: Lindsay was excited to be a new mom, but her feelings of joy and love were instantly overshadowed by postpartum anxiety and obsessive compulsive disorder.

item.title: Moving on from Past Mistakes
item.description: Rachel's self worth was very low after she got pregnant at 16. She talks about her experience going back to high school after giving up her child for adoption.

item.title: Returning to Prayer
item.description: When Mike thought hope, happiness, and even life were over, prayer gave him power to pull through.

item.title: Serving as a Caretaker
item.description: When Shermeka heard that her niece had been abandoned at a local fire station, she made a choice that would change her life forever.

item.title: Returning Early from a Mission
item.description: Jake was eagerly planning to serve as a full-time missionary in South Carolina for two years, but things don’t always go according to plan.

item.title: Falling out of Love with a Spouse
item.description: When she fell in love with Brandon, Lluvia thought she was living a fairy tale. Then, after ten years of marriage and in the midst of life challenges, they drifted apart.

item.title: Finding Your Purpose in Life: Does Faith Matter?
item.description: Rich Miller grew up believing completely in the reality and importance of the gospel. But Rich left his faith behind to search for another kind of truth. He was surprised by what he found.

item.title: Drug Addiction and the Loss of a Loved One
item.description: By God’s grace we are able to overcome any challenge life brings. And with His Grace we are able to feel the much needed love and comfort amidst our trials.

item.title: Life after War and Overcoming Post-traumatic Stress
item.description: The Taylor brothers have always been close, but enduring war, posttraumatic stress, and heroin addiction together brought them closer to each other and closer to Jesus Christ than they ever imagined possible.

item.title: Pornography Addiction: Is There Hope?
item.description: Elizabeth was 11 years old when she first came across pornography. After a long struggle with addiction, fear, and hopelessness, she felt Jesus Christ's power and desire to heal her.

item.title: Prescription Drugs, Addiction, and Hope for Change
item.description: At first, using pain pills was a social experience for Jordan. As his addiction grew, he was willing to do anything to get them. He knew he could not change without help.

item.title: Unplanned Pregnancy, Adoption and The “Best Gift Ever”
item.description: When Katie became a single mother following an unplanned pregnancy, she couldn’t have imagined the impact her adoption story would have on her faith and others’.

item.title: The Perfect Lie | Tiffany Webster
item.description: When Tiffany Webster was 15 years old, someone asked what she hoped her life would look like in another 15 years. She saw perfection. But as checklists grew longer and expectations grew harder to meet, Tiffany felt exhausted and broken.

item.title: A Question That Put Life in Perspective | Stephen Jones
item.description: Stephen Jones has always had a passion for performing, but when it came to providing for his growing family, he wondered if it would be enough.

item.title: We Aren’t God’s Only People | Samuel Hislop
item.description: Years ago, Samuel Hislop moved to Eastern Ukraine. He discovered that the Ukrainian people, who came from cultural and religious backgrounds very different from his, had much to teach him as well.

item.title: Spiritual Beings and the Human Experience | Matt Townsend
item.description: Before Matt Townsend built his own successful relationship coaching practice, he was labeled “the jam bomber” and “loin boy” as a preteen. How do labels change our perceptions of ourselves? Who are we really?

item.title: Seeing Green | Jill Thomas
item.description: Jill Thomas lost her daughter Penny in a tragic accident. Though she had heard that the death of a loved one puts faith to the test, she was not prepared for the devastation she felt.

item.title: Living Beyond “What If?” | Cambry Kaylor
item.description: Cambry Kaylor was a promising equestrian vaulter with dreams of competing internationally. At age 18 she suffered an accident while vaulting, leaving her a paraplegic, but that didn’t stop her from achieving her dreams.

item.title: Taming Technology in the Home
item.description: Technology enables us to be forces for good in the world, but sometimes it distracts us from being present in our families.

item.title: Setting Realistic Expectations with Self, Spouse, and Kids
item.description: Learning when to say “Yes” and how to gracefully say “No” can be key in retaining some of our most important relationships.

item.title: When Life is Less Than Ideal
item.description: The ideal family situation includes a loving mother, a caring father, obedient children, and harmony in the home. So what can you do when that’s just not the case for your family?

item.title: Parenting Young Adults
item.description: Wendy Ulrich, a mother and licensed psychologist, shares personal stories and insights to help answer questions about raising young adults, which may sometimes be more challenging than parenting young children.

item.title: How to Teach the Joys of Service
item.description: When life feels dark, overwhelming, or lonely, what can we do to find peace? Reaching outside of ourselves to serve others who are also in need may seem counterintuitive, but it is a healing balm that is tried and true.

item.title: How to Talk to Your Kids about Intimacy
item.description: Intimidated by The Talk? Here are ideas on how to talk to your kids about sexual relationships.

item.title: How to Talk to Your Kids about Pornography
item.description: M. Joseph Brough, second counselor in the Young Men general presidency, and Alaina Chatterly, a mental health therapist for teenagers, share personal stories and expert insights to help answer these questions.

item.title: How to Teach Your Child How the Spirit Speaks to Them
item.description: Bonnie H. Cordon, the second counselor in the Primary general presidency, suggests that learning the language of the Spirit is easiest when it starts at home, where children can be immersed in it.

item.title: Fostering Independence in Children
item.description: Jean B. Bingham, first counselor in the Primary general presidency, and author Merrilee Boyack share personal stories and expert insights to help answer these questions in this episode of Gospel Solutions for Families.

item.title: Living Without Guilt When Your Child Chooses a Different Path
item.description: Robin Zenger Baker, author of Finding Peace When a Child Chooses Another Path, has studied psychology, organizational behavior, and family therapy. She shares personal stories and professional insights to answer questions.

item.title: Dealing with Kids Suffering from Anxiety or Depression
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, first counselor in the Young Women General Presidency, and Heather Nelson, a licensed clinical social worker, share personal stories and expert insights to help answer questions in this episode of Gospel Solutions for Families.

item.title: The District: Time to Shine
item.description: Eight Mormon missionaries share their experiences teaching people, and one Elder tells about what led him to serve a mission and leave his rock band behind.

item.title: The District: Brothers and Sisters
item.description: A few Mormon missionaries struggle to find someone to teach. The sister missionaries try to help a family decide on baptism, but when tragedy strikes at home, Sister Voyles has to decide if she should stay or go home.

item.title: The District: Number One
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries find someone to baptize in a man who has already been attending church for the past 30 years. Elder Moreno shares why he left a promising professional soccer career to serve a mission.

item.title: A Great Instrument
item.description: Elder Tuituu, a Mormon missionary, shares his decision to serve a mission and leave his home in Guam. Two Elders hope that a trip to general conference will answer their investigator’s concerns.

item.title: The District: Perfect
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries start teaching John who is living with an LDS family. When John starts dating a member of the family, things get more complicated.

item.title: The District: Saved for a Reason
item.description: When two Mormon missionaries begin teaching a man from China, they find it difficult to get past the cultural and language barriers.

item.title: The District: Turning Point
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries encourage a man who is struggling with a drinking problem. And some Elders find an investigator who loves the missionaries but isn’t too sure about “all the little rules” they live by.

item.title: The District: Coming Home
item.description: Two Mormon missionaries teach a family who is trying to decide if they are ready for a change. And Elder Bott shares how his decision to serve a mission is blessing his family at home.
